page.title: 12Health of Bourtie farmers
page.content: With the increased use of chemical fertilizers, foliar and fungal spray on farms, many farmers are conscious of the effects on their food and heath. Most amilies who till the land in the parish of ourtie reserve a small plot in a field close to the farmhouse to row itchen vegetables such a a row each of cabbage, cauliflower, lettuce, peas, carrots and a large plot of potatoes. When in 1980 a farmer discovered that a foliar spray used on an adjacent field crop had demolished his crop of lettuces, he was careful not to use that chemical again. This attitue has been reflected more recently in a marginal turnaround to the older ways of crop rotation and minimal use of chemical sprays.
